ext_descriptions.ext_description: A date_or_event type is a formal mechanism to refer either to a Calendar_date, a Date_time, or an Event.

An event_item type is an extensible list of alternate entity data types. It provides a mechanism to refer to instances of the data types included in the types that extend the event_item type. This empty extensible select type requires extension in a further module, to ensure that any entity data type that refers to it can have a valid instantiation.

An Event is the fact of the existence of a state at some point in time. The event may have occurred or may be not yet started.
The point in time where an event will start or started, may not be known or specified.
is the identifier that distinguishes the Event.
is the words by which the event is known. 'Start of production' and 'break down of machine A' are examples of event names.
is the text that further characterizes the event. The value of the attribute need not be specified.
is the Calendar_date or Date_time when the event is or was planned to start. The value of the attribute need not be specified.
is the Calendar_date or Date_time when the event started. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

An Event_relationship specifies a relationship which exists between two events. An instance of this entity data type with relation_type 'sequence' may be used to specify that an event shall end before another event starts.
is a further description of the relationship. The value of the attribute need not be specified.
A Relative_event is an Event the start of which will occur, respectively has occurred, with a time offset from the start of another Event.
is the Event with respect which the relative event is based on.
is the difference in time between the start of both events. A negative offset specifies that the relative_event occurs before the base_event.
